page.title: 06UNEMPLOYMENT - PAISLEY
page.content: Within our block there is a great deal of unemployment. This has been a problem now for many years due to closure of the car factory in nearby Linwood and declining shipbuilding on the lower reaches of the River Clyde. Many adult men have been unemployed for more than 2 years; except in the case of a few who have managed to work short term in a shipyard constructing oil rigs for the North Sea. For the most part the men who have worked in the above industries are mainly unemployed, passing the long day housebound or in town looking for another job, which is not there. A neighbour of mine who does not wish to be named is unfortunately unemployed and gave me these facts. He says being unemployed is very hard for himself and for his family.
